byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer reported from Washington, and Alexander Burns from New York. Ashley Parker and Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.
byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and ALEXANDER BURNS

abstract: Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump meets with House Speaker Paul D Ryan in attempt at reconciliation; Ryan calls Trump 'warm and genuine' after meeting, in what is seen as remarkable turnaround; Trump also meets with senators and lawmakers worried about tone and direction of his campaign.
lead_paragraph: Speaker Paul D. Ryan came away from his meeting with Donald J. Trump feeling positive, though Mr. Ryan still did not endorse him.

headline.main: Donald Trump and Paul Ryan Show Signs of Thaw
headline.print_headline: Signs of Thaw in Trump Visit With Speaker

snippet: Speaker Paul D. Ryan came away from his meeting with Donald J. Trump feeling positive, though Mr. Ryan still did not endorse him.
